intro: Justicia riopalenquensis, commonly known as the Rio Palenquensis flameflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
